title: Worked Solution
text:
To determine whether a given value is a solution to a given equation, you can substitute the value into the equation in place of the variable and see whether the equation is satisfied.
So, if we substitute $$y= rac{7}{5}$$ into the equation $$5y+3=10y-4$$, we get:
$$5\left( rac{7}{5}ight)+3=\operatorname{10}\left( rac{7}{5}ight)-4$$
$$ rac{35}{5}+3= rac{70}{5}-4$$
$$ rac{35}{5}+3=14-4$$
$$ rac{35}{5}+3=10$$
$$ rac{35+15}{5}=10$$
$$ rac{50}{5}=10$$
$$10=10$$
Since the equation is satisfied when $$y= rac{7}{5}$$, this value is indeed a solution to the equation.
